items.title: Live: 'I am the president': Deposed Venezuelan leader Maduro, wife enter pleas in New York
items.description: Nicolás Maduro and his wife face court in New York for the first time since being captured by US forces, as an emergency meeting of the UN Security Council gets underway. Follow live.

items.title: UN chief warns US operation in Venezuela sets dangerous precedent
items.description: The warning by the UN chief comes during an emergency session of the United Nations Security Council, just blocks from where Nicolás Maduro and his wife Cilia Flores are facing a Manhattan judge.

items.title: Trump's historic oil grab a brazen push for extraordinary power
items.description: In a world awash with oil, US President Donald Trump's takeover of Venezuela seems to be more about power than production.

items.title: Bruce Lehrmann launches High Court appeal in latest defamation battle round
items.description: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann takes his appeal to the High Court against the findings that he, on the balance of probabilities, raped Brittany Higgins in 2019.

items.title: Towns facing temperatures above 45C as extreme heatwave blasts Australia
items.description: The "most significant" heatwave south-eastern Australia has seen in six years is likely to trigger an extreme fire danger alongside searing hot temperatures.

items.title: Tree by tree, this new suburb is dodging baking heat in summer
items.description: Thousands of young trees dot the streets and front gardens of this outer Melbourne suburb as part of a neighbourhood-wide push to create more shade and curb the urban heat island effect.

items.title: Paris court finds 10 people guilty of cyberbullying Brigitte Macron
items.description: Several defendants told the court their comments were intended as humour or satire.

items.title: Denmark tells Trump to stop Greenland 'threats'
items.description: The leaders of Denmark and Greenland have urged US President Donald Trump to stop threatening to take over Greenland.

items.title: Batting class prevails for Head and Root on a fiery day in Sydney
items.description: In what has been a bowlers' series, the class of Joe Root and Travis Head again shone on day two in Sydney, where it often took something silly for a wicket to fall.

items.title: Here's what to expect from the RBA this year with rate hikes on the table
items.description: Mortgage borrowers and savers may have used the new year as an excuse to get their financial affairs in order, but things may be set to change within a matter of months.

items.title: Insurance, Centrelink repayments 'final nail in coffin' for abuse survivors
items.description: When survivors of child sexual abuse receive compensation, many may have to repay Centrelink, Medicare and private health insurance amounts relating to their abuse.

items.title: Lifesavers say 'swim between flags' message not enough after drownings
items.description: Surf lifesavers are rethinking their iconic beach safety message after multiple drownings at remote or unpatrolled swim spots in NSW.

items.title: Prison escapee attacks Victorian farm worker
items.description: A farm worker says he was threatened by a man who escaped from Langi Kal Kal prison near Ballarat.

items.title: How a 'ruthless' energy company went after a pensioner for money he didn't owe
items.description: Australia's energy prices continue to soar as questions continue to be raised about the actions of providers, including by this pensioner who was overcharged and then had debt collectors chasing him.

items.title: Tasmania's bioluminescence unrelated to salmon farm nutrients, scientist says
items.description: Scientists say a bioluminescent algae causes the red tides at the centre of recent environmentalist concerns — but that's not to say the magnificent display is totally harmless to marine life.

items.title: Algae fears boost business in unaffected SA tourist towns
items.description: An algal bloom that has been ravaging parts of SA's coast for months is pushing visitors to head to other parts of the state.

items.title: North-west Queensland towns wait for flooding to reside to begin clean-up
items.description: A traveller is in hospital after walking nearly 40 kilometres after he became bogged in outback Queensland on Saturday.

items.title: How a sour rivalry thrust figure skating into the realm of soap opera
items.description: The gentile and sequined world of figure skating had its dark side exposed in a drama worthy of a soap opera in 1994, as Nancy Kerrigan was the victim of a dastardly plot to eliminate her from the Winter Olympics.

items.title: Former Labor politicians urge Albanese to call Bondi federal royal commission
items.description: A group of former Labor MPs, senators and party officials have signed an open letter asking Anthony Albanese to call a national royal commission into the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: Queensland government unveils plans for Olympic stadium
items.description: The new stadium will host the opening and closing ceremonies and athletics at the 2032 Games, before becoming the city’s main stadium with 63,000 seats.

items.title: How the generation gap is being bridged in this country town
items.description: In a country town near Canberra, a program run by an aged care provider and the local high school is seeing positive results in breaking down barriers between younger and older community members.

items.title: 'Money talks': Big win to stop Sydney marina expansion could be short-lived
items.description: Local groups that helped save heritage-listed Kelly's Bush Park from being impacted by a marina expansion proposal are calling on the NSW government to do more to protect the foreshore.

items.title: Businesses offering a 'safe space' for those experiencing domestic violence
items.description: Born from her own experience, a Townsville woman is encouraging businesses to offer 'DV safe spaces' for those who are experiencing domestic and family violence.

items.title: Police employee faces court over alleged antisemitic online posts
items.description: Muamer Nukic, a 50-year-old Queensland Police Service employee and described as a "self-proclaimed anti-Zionist" was granted bail in the Brisbane Magistrate Court on Monday.

items.title: Police investigate burglary at offices of comedy troupe Sooshi Mango
items.description: The group posted CCTV footage on social media appearing to show a man breaking into an office in Carlton.
